newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent hits new session high on bullish US data.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent hits new session high on bullish US data.

text.p: IPE oil futures jumped to fresh session highs after today's U.S. Department of Energy data painted a more bullish picture for distillate inventories, traders said.
"The DOEs turbocharged the APIs," said Charles Gray, energy analyst at Prudential in London.
Crude also rallied, he said, on news rebel Kurdish guerrillas attacked a twin oil pipeline from Turkey to Iraq.
It caused an oil spill and fire but no interruption of Iraq's crude sales under a U.N. deal, oil officials said.
At 1557 GMT, March Brent was up 38 cents at $22.86 a barrel. It hit a session high of $22.90 which is within a hair of an upside gap at $22.94 to $23.04.
The Energy Information Administration said distillate stocks fell last week by 4.8 million barrels, against Tuesday's American Petroleum Institute reported drop of nearly 3.0 million.
But the EIA said crude stocks fell only 1.5 million barrels, against an API draw of 3.4 million.
Feb gas oil gained $5.50 to $208.50 a tonne.
Leslie Nicholas, energy analyst at GNI, said weather forecasts for the Northeast U.S. through Feb 1 were not overly bullish for heating oil and distillate supplies were keeping up with demand.
But refinery turnarounds eventually could improve the heating oil picture as the "need to produce gasoline ahead of the driving season will soon become a focus."
